header: (Page No.1) Cri.M.A.No.28/2019 Criminal M. A. (Anticipatory Bail) No. 28/2019 Smt. Sitabai Hanmant Sathe Vs. State of Maharashtra

background.text:
ORDER BELOW EX. 1 1. This is an application for grant of anticipatory bail under Section 438 of Criminal Procedure Code. Brief facts of the applicant's case are as under :­ 
2. One victim girl lodged complaint in Police Station, Rahimatpur, and alleged that she resides in Matang Vasti, Rahimatpur along with her family members. She is aged 17 years, 11 days, suffering from HIV disease. Another accused Ajay Netke resides near her house, used to talk with her. After some period, they both fall in love of each other. In June 2017 she had been to Civil Hospital, Satara, to bring her medicine tablets. At that time, while returning, he gave lift to her, took at Janai Malai mountain and committed sexual intercourse with her forcibly. This incident of rape was repeated in August 2017 by accused. According to first informant, the accused No.2 is common friend of accused No.1 and first informant. She threatened her not to lodge complaint in Police Station. Hence, police have registered F.I.R. against accused No. 1 and 2 vide C.R.No.221/2018 for the offence punishable under Section 363, 366­A, 376 (2) (I), 506, 34 of Indian Penal Code and Section 6 of Protection of Children from Sexual Offences Act, 2012.

arguments.text: 3. Accused contended that she is innocent, she is not involved in activity of alleged rape, she has apprehension of her arrest in the above said crime. First informant has filed false complaint against her and alleged that she gave threat. Her custody is not necessary for investigation. Hence, she has prayed to grant anticipatory bail.

argumentSentences.text: Accused contended that she is innocent, she is not involved in activity of alleged rape, she has apprehension of her arrest in the above said crime.
First informant has filed false complaint against her and alleged that she gave threat.
Her custody is not necessary for investigation.
Hence, she has prayed to grant anticipatory bail.

arguments.text: 4. The A.P.P. for the State has filed his Say at Ex. 6 and contended that victim girl is aged 17 years, allegations against accused are serious. Custody of the applicant, is essential for further investigation. Hence, application be rejected.

argumentSentences.text: The A.P.P. for the State has filed his Say at Ex.
6 and contended that victim girl is aged 17 years, allegations against accused are serious.
Custody of the applicant, is essential for further investigation.

arguments.text: 5. Perused the application, Say, copy of F.I.R., on record. It appears that allegations of rape are against accused No.1 only. There are no allegations of kidnapping or rape against accused No.2. She is working as 'Kotwal'. Accused No.1 is in jail. Investigation is over. Her custody is not necessary. It appears that the interim protection is already granted to applicant by order of this Court, dated 17/1/2019. Considering the reasons stated above, I do not find any wrong if interim anticipatory bail granted to the applicant is confirmed. Hence, I proceed to pass following order :­

argumentSentences.text: Perused the application, Say, copy of F.I.R., on record.
It appears that allegations of rape are against accused No.1 only.
There are no allegations of kidnapping or rape against accused No.2.
It appears that the interim protection is already granted to applicant by order of this Court, dated 17/1/2019.
Considering the reasons stated above, I do not find any wrong if interim anticipatory bail granted to the applicant is confirmed.
Hence, I proceed to pass following order :­

order.text: ORDER 1. Application is allowed. 2. In the event of arrest of applicant/accused Smt. Sitabai Hanmant Sathe in C.R.No.221/2018 registered in Rahimatpur Police Station for the offence punishable under Section 363, 366­ A, 376 (2) (I) (n), 506, 34 of Indian Penal Code and Section 6 of Protection of Children from Sexual Offences Act, she be released on anticipatory bail on executing P.B. and S.B. of Rs. 15,000/­ with one solvent local surety for like amount, on following conditions :­ i) Applicant shall make available for interrogation in Police Station concerned in between 10.00 a.m. to 1.00 p.m. on every alternate day till filing of charge­sheet. ii) She shall not leave India without permission of Court. iii) She shall not tamper the evidence of prosecution. iv) She shall not contact in any way with victim girl. 3. Breach of any of the conditions shall amount to cancellation of bail. 4. Inform concerned Police Station accordingly.

footer: (Anis A. J. Khan) Date : 15/2/2019 Additional Sessions Judge Satara.
processedText:
(Page No.1) Cri.M.A.No.28/2019 Criminal M. A. (Anticipatory Bail) No. 28/2019 Smt. Sitabai Hanmant Sathe Vs. State of Maharashtra 
---header-ends---
ORDER BELOW EX. 1 1. This is an application for grant of anticipatory bail under Section 438 of Criminal Procedure Code. Brief facts of the applicant's case are as under :­ 
2. One victim girl lodged complaint in Police Station, Rahimatpur, and alleged that she resides in Matang Vasti, Rahimatpur along with her family members. She is aged 17 years, 11 days, suffering from HIV disease. Another accused Ajay Netke resides near her house, used to talk with her. After some period, they both fall in love of each other. In June 2017 she had been to Civil Hospital, Satara, to bring her medicine tablets. At that time, while returning, he gave lift to her, took at Janai Malai mountain and committed sexual intercourse with her forcibly. This incident of rape was repeated in August 2017 by accused. According to first informant, the accused No.2 is common friend of accused No.1 and first informant. She threatened her not to lodge complaint in Police Station. Hence, police have registered F.I.R. against accused No. 1 and 2 vide C.R.No.221/2018 for the offence punishable under Section 363, 366­A, 376 (2) (I), 506, 34 of Indian Penal Code and Section 6 of Protection of Children from Sexual Offences Act, 2012. 
---background-ends---
3. Accused contended that she is innocent, she is not involved in activity of alleged rape, she has apprehension of her arrest in the above said crime. First informant has filed false complaint against her and alleged that she gave threat. Her custody is not necessary for investigation. Hence, she has prayed to grant anticipatory bail. 
---argument-ends---
4. The A.P.P. for the State has filed his Say at Ex. 6 and contended that victim girl is aged 17 years, allegations against accused are serious. Custody of the applicant, is essential for further investigation. Hence, application be rejected. 
---argument-ends---
5. Perused the application, Say, copy of F.I.R., on record. It appears that allegations of rape are against accused No.1 only. There are no allegations of kidnapping or rape against accused No.2. She is working as 'Kotwal'. Accused No.1 is in jail. Investigation is over. Her custody is not necessary. It appears that the interim protection is already granted to applicant by order of this Court, dated 17/1/2019. Considering the reasons stated above, I do not find any wrong if interim anticipatory bail granted to the applicant is confirmed. Hence, I proceed to pass following order :­ 
---argument-ends---
ORDER 1. Application is allowed. 2. In the event of arrest of applicant/accused Smt. Sitabai Hanmant Sathe in C.R.No.221/2018 registered in Rahimatpur Police Station for the offence punishable under Section 363, 366­ A, 376 (2) (I) (n), 506, 34 of Indian Penal Code and Section 6 of Protection of Children from Sexual Offences Act, she be released on anticipatory bail on executing P.B. and S.B. of Rs. 15,000/­ with one solvent local surety for like amount, on following conditions :­ i) Applicant shall make available for interrogation in Police Station concerned in between 10.00 a.m. to 1.00 p.m. on every alternate day till filing of charge­sheet. ii) She shall not leave India without permission of Court. iii) She shall not tamper the evidence of prosecution. iv) She shall not contact in any way with victim girl. 3. Breach of any of the conditions shall amount to cancellation of bail. 4. Inform concerned Police Station accordingly. 
---order-ends---
(Anis A. J. Khan) Date : 15/2/2019 Additional Sessions Judge Satara.
